DocsVerse is a document research chatbot Kushagra developed that combines OCR (Optical Character Recognition) with RAG (Retrieval-Augmented Generation) to enable intelligent document analysis and question-answering. The system can process multiple document formats (PDF, DOCX, images), extract text using Tesseract OCR, and create embeddings for semantic search. It uses FAISS for efficient vector similarity search and integrates with LLMs to provide contextually relevant answers to user queries about document content. The system includes a user-friendly web interface built with Next.js and features document management capabilities, conversation history, and export functionality.

SynapTrack is an innovative project Kushagra developed for Parkinson's disease detection using EEG (Electroencephalogram) analysis. The system processes raw EEG signals through advanced signal processing techniques including wavelet transforms and feature extraction. It implements a hybrid deep learning model combining CNN and LSTM architectures to detect subtle patterns in brain activity associated with Parkinson's disease. The model achieved 91% accuracy in early-stage detection, significantly improving over traditional diagnostic methods. The project includes a clinician-friendly dashboard for result visualization and patient monitoring, and was developed in collaboration with healthcare professionals to ensure clinical relevance.

Data Orchestrate is a distributed file synchronization system Kushagra built using Java and Kubernetes. The system enables real-time file synchronization across multiple devices with conflict resolution capabilities. It implements a microservices architecture with separate services for authentication, file management, synchronization, and notification. The system uses WebSockets for real-time updates and implements a custom versioning system to track file changes. It was deployed using Docker and Kubernetes for scalability and reliability, with automated CI/CD pipelines for continuous deployment. The project demonstrates Kushagra's expertise in distributed systems, cloud-native architecture, and enterprise Java development.

The Airfield Wildlife Risk Classification project is a real-time bird detection system Kushagra developed to enhance aviation safety. The system uses computer vision with YOLOv8 for real-time detection and classification of bird species near airfields. It implements a custom-trained model on a dataset of 50,000+ images of birds commonly found near airports, achieving 94% detection accuracy. The system includes a risk assessment algorithm that evaluates factors like bird size, flock density, and flight patterns to calculate threat levels. It provides real-time alerts to air traffic control through a low-latency notification system and includes a dashboard for historical data analysis and pattern recognition. The project demonstrates Kushagra's expertise in computer vision, embedded systems, and safety-critical applications.

PlantWise is an Ayurvedic AI Companion that Kushagra developed, which reached the Top 25 at Smart India Hackathon (SIH) 2024. The system combines computer vision for plant identification with a knowledge base of Ayurvedic medicine to provide personalized health recommendations. It features a mobile application with image recognition capabilities that can identify 250+ medicinal plants with 96% accuracy. The backend implements a recommendation engine that matches plant properties with user health profiles and Ayurvedic principles. The system includes features for tracking usage, providing dosage information, and warning about potential contraindications. It also offers educational content about Ayurvedic practices and sustainable harvesting methods. The project demonstrates Kushagra's ability to combine traditional knowledge with cutting-edge AI technology.

The Driver Safety Monitoring System is an embedded system Kushagra developed for real-time monitoring of driver behavior and alertness. The system uses a combination of sensors including an MQ3 alcohol sensor, accelerometer, and camera to detect signs of impaired or distracted driving. It implements computer vision algorithms to track eye movement and head position for drowsiness detection. The system features real-time alerts through audio warnings and smartphone notifications when potentially dangerous behaviors are detected. It includes a secure data logging system for trip analysis and driver behavior patterns. The hardware is based on ESP32 and Arduino platforms with custom PCB design for automotive integration. The project demonstrates Kushagra's expertise in embedded systems, sensor fusion, and safety-critical applications.
